sn55.30:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
sn55.30:4.2: Then Nandaka the Licchavi minister went up to the Buddha,
sn55.30:4.3: bowed, and sat down to one side.
sn55.30:5.1: “Nandaka, a noble disciple who has four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
sn55.30:5.3: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.30:5.8: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones …
sn55.30:5.10: A noble disciple who has these four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
sn55.30:6.1: A noble disciple who has these four things is guaranteed long life,
sn55.30:6.5: and authority, both human and divine.
sn55.30:6.6: Now, I don’t say this because I’ve heard it from some other ascetic or brahmin. I only say it because I’ve known, seen, and realized it for myself.”
sn55.30:7.1: When he had spoken, a certain person said to Nandaka:
sn55.30:7.3: “Enough now, I tell you, with that exterior bath.
